bibl.title: Letter from Harold C. Ernst to Caroline Latimer, February 10, 1909

div1.p: Ernst discusses difficulties involving Carnegie funding for the Kissingers.

div1.head: Letter from Harold C. Ernst to Caroline Latimer, February 10, 1909
div1.opener:
Wrote Dr Welch
2/17/09
Harvard University Medical School
THE DEPARTMENT OF BACTERIOLOGY
240 LONGWOOD AVENUE,
BOSTON.
February 10, 1909.
My Dear Doctor Latimer:
div1.p:
Dr. Welch is responsible for the de-
lay in further action in the Kissinger matter. I had
been through all the correspondence including a second ap-
peal to the Carnegie Hero Fund (refused) and was ready to
go to the press of the country with an appeal to be signed
by Drs. Welch, Kelly, Billings, Flexner, Hektoen, Councilman an
myself. Dr. Welch said he wanted to make a personal ap-
peal to Mr. Carnegie. It was understood that he would do
this at once - two months ago. I have been waiting to
hear from his volunatrily, but have not done so, nor has he
taken any notice of two letters I have written asking him
what he had done. If I hear nothing from him in a short
time I shall send out the appeal without his name.
Please tell this to Dr. Kelly. I cannot doubt that the ap-
peal will be successful.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours,- Harold C. Ernst. Dr. Caroline Latimer.
